thread.title: Arsenal news: Chinese clubs willing to pay Rafael Bentiez £600,000-a-week | Metro News
thread.title_full: Arsenal news: Chinese clubs willing to pay Rafael Bentiez £600,000-a-week | Metro News

author: Coral Barry For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal news: Chinese clubs willing to pay Rafael Bentiez £600,000-a-week | Metro News
text:
Chinese clubs willing to pay Rafael Bentiez £600,000-a-week gossip Coral Barry for Metro.co.uk Sunday 26 Feb 2017 3:02 pm Rafael Benitez is rumoured to be one of Arsenal’s managerial candidates (Picture: Getty) 
Rafael Benitez is reportedly the target of incredible offers from China with two clubs ready to pay him £600,000-a-week. Jurgen Klopp sends warning to his Liverpool flops after Leicester loss 
The Newcastle boss has been linked with a move to Arsenal in recent weeks, but would surely be tempted by such a massive salary in China. 
Carlos Tevez earns around £632,000-a-week for Shanghai Shenhua while Andre Villas-Boas is the best paid club manager in the Chinese Super League. 
Villas-Boas earns £11 million-a-year at Shanghai SIPG but Bentiez would far out earn the former Chelsea boss with £30 million-a-year should he make the switch. Arsene Wenger’s future at Arsenal is unclear (Picture: Getty) 
That is according to the Mirror who claim the Newcastle boss is on bad terms with his club hierarchy after they failed to provide him with transfer funds in January. 
Arsenal are sounding out replacements for Arsene Wenger with the Frenchman still uncertain about his future at the club. Bentiez is in his second spell as a manager in England (Picture: Getty)
